meanings.sent1: She redenies eating the last cookie every time I ask.
meanings.sent2: He always redenies his mistakes instead of admitting them.
meanings.sent3: The cat redenies knocking over the vase with a mischievous look in its eyes.
meanings.sent4: The politician redenies any involvement in the scandal, but the evidence speaks otherwise.
meanings.sent5: The child redenies having taken the toy, but the toy is found hidden in their room.

meanings.definition: The act of denying something again or repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: His redenies of the accusations only made the situation worse.
meanings.sent2: The constant redenies from the suspect raised suspicions among the investigators.
meanings.sent3: The redenies of the lost keys led to a comical search around the house.
meanings.sent4: The company's redenies of any wrongdoing were met with skepticism by the public.
meanings.sent5: The repeated redenies of the witness made the jury question their credibility.
